div.p: Hotel proprietor in Galtür, in the Austrian Tyrol.

div.head: Biographical summary
div.p: Franz Anton Türtscher came from Sonntag in the Großer Walsertal, Vorarlberg. Around 1900, he married Emerenzia Walter, the daughter of a wealthy Galtür farmer. In 1905 they acquired the small hotel Rössle in Galtür, which they managed successfully thereafter. The couple had four children: Adolf, Franz, Angela, and Ida. In the early 1920s, the family acquired another small hotel, the Alpenhaus Fluchthorn, the management of which Adolf Türtscher took on, while the Rössle was transferred to Franz.

div.head: Adolf Franz Anton Türtscher and the Schenkers
div.p: The family Türtscher is mentioned in two letters to Schenker from Felix-Eberhard von Cube: OJ 9/34, [13], July 6, 1928 and OJ 9/34, [21], June 25, 1930.

listBibl.bibl: Walter Köck, Paznaun. Stürmisch bis heiter. Allerlei aus dem Paznaun (Galtür 1997), pp. 252 and 254–255
